page.title: 01THORNER-GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
The village of Thorner is set in a shallow valley surrounded by rolling farmland containing both grazing land and some grain crops.
The village itself is one long main through road with a few sideroads. Along Main Street can be found housing with some shops and three public houses.
At one end of Main Street stands the prominent white stoned{Saint Peter's} church.
There are signs of a railway that once ran through the village on its way from Leeds to Wetherby.
The village itself seems mainly residential, there appears to be no industry, besides that of farming.
